1.segment: OBJECTIVE : Serum tumor marker ( STM ) elevation can detect metastasis earlier than imaging diagnosis and ,

3.segment: is still widely used in clinical practice for postoperative follow-up of breast cancer patients .

4.segment: The purpose of this study was to investigate the change rules of CEA and CA153 in patients with HER2-negative breast cancer during postoperative adjuvant chemotherapy and their influencing factors .

5.segment: MATERIALS AND METHODS : The medical records of patients with HER2-negative early breast cancer who visited Xuanwu Hospital from September 2018 to June 2021 were retrospectively analyzed .

6.segment: Demographic characteristics and baseline data of CEA and CA153 at initial diagnosis were collected .

8.segment: biochemistry ( including ALT , AST , rGT , triglycerides , cholesterol , and blood glucose ) and blood routine ( including white blood cells , neutrophils , monocytes , lymphocytes , and platelets ) were also collected before chemotherapy ,

9.segment: at the end of chemotherapy and more than 3 months after the end of chemotherapy .

11.segment: and systemic immune inflammation index ( SII ) were calculated and statistically analyzed using SPSSAU software .

12.segment: RESULTS : A total of 90 patients were enrolled ,

14.segment: with a mean age of 55.11 ± 10.60 y .

15.segment: The value of CEA at initial diagnosis was 2.10 ± 1.11 ng/mL ,

16.segment: and high expression was mostly correlated with past history of chronic diseases and tumor lymph node metastasis ; the value of CA153 was 11.80 ± 6.60 U/mL ,

17.segment: and high expression was correlated with high SII at initial diagnosis .

18.segment: Surgery did not affect the values of serum CEA and CA153 .

20.segment: CEA and CA153 were 2.68 ± 1.34 ng/mL and 18.51 ± 8.50 U/mL ,

21.segment: respectively , which were significantly increased compared with those before chemotherapy ,

22.segment: and were linearly correlated with the values before chemotherapy .

23.segment: They decreased ( CEA 2.45 ± 1.19 ng/mL , CA153 10.87 ± 5.96 U/mL ) again three months after the end of chemotherapy ,

25.segment: which was associated with lymph node metastasis at diagnosis ,

26.segment: body metabolic disorders , and chronic inflammatory status .

27.segment: CONCLUSION : CEA and CA153 were increased presenting as `` spiking '' phenomena in patients with early HER2-negative breast cancer during postoperative adjuvant chemotherapy ,

28.segment: and the peak of increase was linearly correlated with the indicators before chemotherapy .

29.segment: Clinical attention should be paid to this change to avoid excessive diagnosis and treatment leading to medical resource consumption .
